 {"id":"w-q64","title":"Search & Indexing","description":"# Feature: Search & Indexing

## Overview
Implement the hybrid search system that enables natural language queries across all indexed video transcripts. This includes the OpenSearch index setup, hybrid query construction (BM25 keyword + kNN vector similarity), search API endpoint, and search result ranking. Users can search with free-text queries and get results with video references, timestamps, and text snippets.

## User Stories Covered
- S1: Natural language search (hybrid: BM25 + vector)
- S3: Search results link directly to video timestamps (backend: results include video_id, start_time)

## Technical Context

### Files to Create
- `backend/app/services/search.py` - OpenSearch hybrid query builder: BM25 text search + kNN vector search, Reciprocal Rank Fusion for combining scores, result formatting
- `backend/app/schemas/search.py` - SearchRequest (query string, optional filters), SearchResponse (results with video_id, video_title, text, start_time, end_time, speaker, score)
- `backend/app/api/routes/search.py` - GET /search?q=... endpoint with query parameter, returns ranked search results
- `backend/tests/unit/test_search.py` - Query construction and result ranking tests
- `backend/tests/integration/test_search_api.py` - Search API integration tests

### Files to Modify
- `backend/app/main.py` - Mount search router
- `backend/app/api/routes/__init__.py` - Export search router
- `backend/app/core/opensearch.py` - Add index creation/management methods, ensure segments_index exists with correct mapping

### Dependencies
- Feature: Project Scaffolding & Infrastructure (w-6nz) must be complete
- Feature: Video Processing Pipeline (w-csa) must be complete (provides indexed segments)
- OpenSearch 2.11.1 with kNN plugin enabled
- sentence-transformers for query embedding generation (reuses embedding service)

### Key Design Decisions
- Hybrid search: combine BM25 (keyword) and kNN (semantic) results using Reciprocal Rank Fusion (RRF)
- Query embedding uses same BGE model (BAAI/bge-base-en-v1.5) as indexing
- Default results: top 10 segments, sorted by combined RRF score
- Search results include: video_id, video_title, text snippet, start_time, end_time, speaker, relevance score
- OpenSearch segments_index uses English analyzer for text field, HNSW for kNN vectors
- Empty query returns error or empty results (not all documents)

## Implementation Notes
- OpenSearch hybrid query structure:
  ```json
  {
    "query": {
      "bool": {
        "should": [
          {"match": {"text": {"query": "user query", "boost": 1.0}}},
          {"knn": {"embedding": {"vector": [query_embedding], "k": 10}}}
        ]
      }
    }
  }
  ```
- Generate query embedding at search time using the embedding service
- RRF formula: score = sum(1 / (k + rank_i)) where k=60 (standard constant)
- Search results include video_title joined from the indexed document
- Handle edge cases: empty query, no results, OpenSearch connection errors
- Index mapping must have knn=true in settings
- Segment fields indexed: id, video_id, video_title, transcript_id, text, embedding (768-dim), start_time, end_time, speaker, recording_date, created_at

## Testing Requirements

### Test Specification Reference
- Document: docs/testing/phase1-test-specification.md
- Sections: S1 (Natural Language Search), S3 (Timestamp Links in Results)

### Unit Tests
- S1-U01: test_embedding_generation - BGE model generates 768-dim vector
- S1-U02: test_hybrid_query_construction - Both BM25 and kNN clauses present in query
- S1-U03: test_search_result_ranking - Results sorted by score descending
- S1-U04: test_empty_query_handled - Empty string returns empty or error

### Integration Tests
- S1-I01: test_search_finds_keyword_match - Query with known keyword returns matching segment
- S1-I02: test_search_finds_semantic_match - Conceptual query returns semantically relevant segment
- S1-I03: test_search_no_results - Query "nonexistent xyz" returns empty results
- S1-I04: test_search_across_videos - Multi-video search returns results from multiple videos
- S1-I05: test_opensearch_index_mapping - Index has kNN enabled, 768-dim vector field, english analyzer
- S3-I01: test_search_results_include_timestamps - start_time float value present in results
- S3-I02: test_search_results_include_video_id - video_id UUID present in results

### E2E Scenarios
- E2E-01 (steps 7-9): Search for key term, verify result shows video with timestamp
- E2E-04: Search with no results - "nonexistent term xyz123" shows no results message

### Quality Gate
This feature is NOT complete until:
- All S1 unit tests pass (S1-U01 through S1-U04)
- All S1 integration tests pass (S1-I01 through S1-I05)
- All S3 integration tests pass (S3-I01, S3-I02)
- Search finds content from the test video after processing
- Hybrid search returns both keyword and semantic matches
- Search results include video_id, start_time, text, score

## Reference Documentation
- docs/design/data-model.md - OpenSearch segments_index mapping
- docs/design/query-flow.md - Search query handling (Quick mode for Phase 1)
- docs/implementation/phase1.md - Search API endpoint spec
- docs/testing/phase1-test-specification.md - S1 and S3 test specs","status":"closed","priority":2,"issue_type":"feature","created_at":"2026-02-07T14:26:54.68662916+02:00","updated_at":"2026-02-11T08:36:48.849658934+02:00","closed_at":"2026-02-11T08:36:48.849658934+02:00","close_reason":"Closed","dependencies":[{"issue_id":"w-q64","depends_on_id":"w-csa","type":"blocks","created_at":"2026-02-07T14:29:53.411965969+02:00","created_by":"daemon"}]}

Add index creation and management methods to the shared OpenSearch client module, and update the indexing task to reuse them instead of maintaining its own duplicate client/index logic.

- `backend/app/core/opensearch.py` - Add ensure_segments_index(), SEGMENTS_INDEX constant, SEGMENTS_INDEX_BODY mapping

- `backend/app/tasks/indexing.py` - Current index mapping and client logic to consolidate
- `docs/design/data-model.md` - OpenSearch segments_index mapping spec

## Implementation Details
Move the SEGMENTS_INDEX constant, SEGMENTS_INDEX_BODY mapping, and _ensure_index() function from `backend/app/tasks/indexing.py` into `backend/app/core/opensearch.py`. Expose them as public functions:
- `SEGMENTS_INDEX = "segments_index"` (constant)
- `SEGMENTS_INDEX_BODY` (the full mapping dict, already defined in indexing.py)
- `ensure_segments_index(client: OpenSearch) -> None` - creates index if it doesn't exist
- Keep the existing `get_opensearch_client()` function unchanged

Then update `backend/app/tasks/indexing.py` to import from `app.core.opensearch` instead of defining its own \_get_opensearch_client and \_ensure_index.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] SEGMENTS_INDEX, SEGMENTS_INDEX_BODY, ensure_segments_index() defined in opensearch.py

- [ ] Existing indexing task still works (no behavioral change)

-{"id":"w-wqm","title":"Search & Indexing","description":"# Feature: Search & Indexing

## Overview
Implement the OpenSearch indexing and hybrid search (BM25 + vector/kNN) backend. This includes creating the OpenSearch index with proper mappings, the indexing service that bulk-indexes segments with embeddings, and the search API that accepts natural language queries, generates query embeddings, constructs hybrid queries, and returns ranked results with video IDs and timestamps.

## User Stories Covered
- S1: Natural language search (hybrid: BM25 + vector)
- S3 (backend): Search results include video_id and timestamps

## Technical Context

### Files to Create
- `backend/app/services/search.py` - Search service: create_index(), index_segments(segments), hybrid_search(query, limit) â†’ ranked results with video_id, start_time, end_time, text, speaker, score
- `backend/app/api/routes/search.py` - GET /api/search?q=...&limit=10 â†’ search results
- `backend/app/schemas/search.py` - SearchQuery, SearchResult, SearchResponse Pydantic schemas
- `backend/tests/unit/test_search.py` - Search query construction, result ranking tests
- `backend/tests/integration/test_search_api.py` - Search API integration tests

### Files to Modify
- `backend/app/main.py` - Register search routes
- `backend/app/api/routes/__init__.py` - Export search router
- `backend/app/core/opensearch.py` - May need index management helpers
- `backend/app/tasks/indexing.py` - Wire up to search service for bulk indexing

### Dependencies
- Feature 1 (Scaffolding): OpenSearch client, config
- Feature 3 (Pipeline): Embedding service, segments with embeddings exist in DB
- External: opensearch-py, sentence-transformers (for query embedding)

### Key Design Decisions
- OpenSearch index name: "segments" (or configurable via settings)
- Index mapping: text (english analyzer), embedding (knn_vector 768-dim, HNSW, cosine), video_id, video_title, transcript_id, start_time, end_time, speaker, recording_date, created_at
- KNN enabled on index: settings.index.knn = true
- Hybrid search combines BM25 text match + kNN vector similarity
- Query embedding generated at search time using same BGE model as indexing
- Results ranked by combined score (Reciprocal Rank Fusion or weighted combination)
- Empty query returns empty results (not error)
- Search results include: video_id, video_title, text, start_time, end_time, speaker, score
- Limit/offset pagination support

## Implementation Notes
- OpenSearch index creation should be idempotent (check if exists first)
- Use opensearch-py bulk API for indexing segments
- Hybrid query structure: use OpenSearch "bool" query with "should" clauses for BM25 + script_score for kNN
- Alternatively, use OpenSearch native hybrid search if available in 2.11
- Query embedding: use same embedding.generate_embedding() from embedding service
- BM25 query: match on "text" field with english analyzer
- kNN query: cosinesimil on "embedding" field
- Result deduplication: if same segment appears in both BM25 and kNN results, take highest score
- Add video_title to indexed document for display in search results
- For testing: create test index with known documents, verify query returns expected results

## Testing Requirements

### Test Specification Reference
- Document: docs/testing/phase1-test-specification.md
- Sections: S1: Natural Language Search, S3: Timestamp Links in Results, C1 (partial - indexing)

### Unit Tests
- S1-U01: test_embedding_generation - BGE model generates 768-dim vector
- S1-U02: test_hybrid_query_construction - BM25 + kNN query both present
- S1-U03: test_search_result_ranking - Results sorted by score (highest first)
- S1-U04: test_empty_query_handled - Empty string returns empty results

### Integration Tests
- S1-I01: test_search_finds_keyword_match - Query keyword returns matching segment
- S1-I02: test_search_finds_semantic_match - Semantic query returns relevant segment
- S1-I03: test_search_no_results - Nonsense query returns empty results
- S1-I04: test_search_across_videos - Results from multiple indexed videos
- S1-I05: test_opensearch_index_mapping - Index has correct schema (kNN enabled, 768-dim, english analyzer)
- S3-I01: test_search_results_include_timestamps - start_time float present in results
- S3-I02: test_search_results_include_video_id - video_id UUID present in results
- C1-I02: test_chunks_indexed_to_opensearch - OpenSearch doc count matches DB segment count

### E2E Scenarios
- E2E-01 (steps 7-9): Search for key term, verify result found
- E2E-04: Search with no results, verify empty handling

### Quality Gate
This feature is NOT complete until:
- All S1-U*, S1-I*, S3-I* tests pass
- Hybrid search returns relevant results for both keyword and semantic queries
- Index mapping correct with kNN enabled
- Empty/nonsense queries handled gracefully
- Search results include video_id, start_time, text, speaker

## Reference Documentation
- docs/design/data-model.md - OpenSearch segments_index mapping
- docs/design/query-flow.md - Hybrid search architecture
- docs/design/search-api.md - Search API endpoints
- docs/implementation/phase1.md - OpenSearch index spec, search endpoints
- docs/testing/phase1-test-specification.md - S1, S3, C1 test specs","status":"tombstone","priority":2,"issue_type":"feature","created_at":"2026-02-07T13:56:35.991471432+02:00","updated_at":"2026-02-07T14:15:16.592442983+02:00","close_reason":"Starting fresh - recreating features with proper dependencies","dependencies":[{"issue_id":"w-wqm","depends_on_id":"w-pi2","type":"blocks","created_at":"2026-02-07T14:10:38.724651784+02:00","created_by":"daemon"}],"deleted_at":"2026-02-07T14:15:16.592442983+02:00","deleted_by":"daemon","delete_reason":"delete","original_type":"feature"}

-{"id":"w-ych","title":"Library & Search UI","description":"# Feature: Library & Search UI

## Overview
Implement the video library view (home page) with video cards, filtering, sorting, and status badges, plus the search page with search bar, results display with timestamp links, and navigation to video playback. This completes the frontend experience for browsing and finding video content.

## User Stories Covered
- M1: Video library view with status/filtering
- S1 (frontend): Search bar and query submission
- S3 (frontend): Search results with clickable timestamp links
- V3 (frontend): Status badges with distinct colors

## Technical Context

### Files to Create
- `backend/app/api/routes/videos.py` - (extend) GET /api/videos (list with pagination, filtering, sorting)
- `frontend/src/pages/LibraryPage.tsx` - Library page: video grid/list, filters, sort controls
- `frontend/src/pages/SearchPage.tsx` - Search page: search bar, results list, loading state, no-results state
- `frontend/src/components/library/VideoCard.tsx` - Video card: thumbnail, title, status badge, recording date, participants count
- `frontend/src/components/library/VideoList.tsx` - Filterable/sortable video list container
- `frontend/src/components/common/StatusBadge.tsx` - Status badge component with color coding: ready=green, processing/transcribing/chunking/indexing=yellow, error=red, uploaded=gray
- `frontend/src/components/common/Layout.tsx` - Page layout with navigation header
- `frontend/src/components/common/Navigation.tsx` - Navigation bar: Library, Upload, Search links
- `frontend/src/components/search/SearchBar.tsx` - Search input with submit on Enter, loading state
- `frontend/src/components/search/SearchResults.tsx` - Results list: video title, text snippet, timestamp link, speaker label
- `frontend/src/api/search.ts` - API client: searchVideos(query, limit, offset) â†’ SearchResponse
- `frontend/src/__tests__/components/VideoCard.test.tsx` - Card rendering tests
- `frontend/src/__tests__/pages/LibraryPage.test.tsx` - Library page tests
- `frontend/src/__tests__/pages/SearchPage.test.tsx` - Search page tests
- `frontend/src/__tests__/components/SearchBar.test.tsx` - Search bar tests
- `backend/tests/integration/test_video_api.py` - (extend) List videos API tests

### Files to Modify
- `backend/app/api/routes/videos.py` - Add GET /api/videos with query params: status, sort, limit, offset
- `frontend/src/App.tsx` - Wire up LibraryPage at / and /library, SearchPage at /search
- `frontend/src/api/videos.ts` - Add listVideos(params) API call

### Dependencies
- Feature 1 (Scaffolding): Base app, routing, types
- Feature 2 (Upload): Video records in DB
- Feature 4 (Search): Search API backend endpoint
- Feature 5 (Playback): VideoPage for navigation targets, TimestampLink component

### Key Design Decisions
- Library page is the home page (route: / and /library)
- Video cards show thumbnail (or placeholder), title, recording_date, status badge, participant count
- Filter by status: dropdown with "All", "Ready", "Processing", "Error"
- Sort by: recording_date (default desc), title, created_at
- Pagination: load more button or infinite scroll (simple offset-based)
- Status badge colors: ready=green, processing/transcribing/chunking/indexing=yellow/amber, error=red, uploaded=gray
- Search page: centered search bar, results below
- Search results show: video title, text snippet (highlighted match), timestamp (formatted as MM:SS), speaker label
- Clicking result timestamp navigates to /videos/{id}?t={start_time}
- Empty search shows prompt text ("Search across your video library...")
- No results shows friendly message
- Loading state shows spinner
- Navigation: always visible header with links to Library, Upload, Search

## Implementation Notes
- GET /api/videos query params: ?status=ready&sort=recording_date&order=desc&limit=20&offset=0
- Backend uses SQLAlchemy query with optional filters and ordering
- Frontend uses axios to call list/search APIs
- VideoCard links to /videos/{id}
- StatusBadge uses Tailwind classes for colors (bg-green-100 text-green-800, etc.)
- SearchResults map over results, render TimestampLink for each
- Use react-router-dom Link for navigation
- Layout component wraps all pages with Navigation
- data-testid attributes: library-page, video-card, status-badge-{status}, library-empty, search-input, search-loading, search-result, no-results, filter-status, sort-control

## Testing Requirements

### Test Specification Reference
- Document: docs/testing/phase1-test-specification.md
- Sections: M1: Video Library View, S1 (frontend), S3 (frontend), V3 (frontend)

### Integration Tests (Backend)
- M1-I01: test_list_videos_returns_all - GET /api/videos returns all videos
- M1-I02: test_list_videos_pagination - limit/offset params work
- M1-I03: test_list_videos_filter_by_status - ?status=ready filters correctly
- M1-I04: test_list_videos_sort_by_date - ?sort=recording_date orders correctly

### Frontend Unit Tests
- M1-F01: test_library_page_renders - Video list displayed
- M1-F02: test_video_card_displays_metadata - Title, date, status visible on card
- M1-F03: test_filter_controls_present - Status filter dropdown present
- M1-F04: test_sort_controls_present - Sort by date option present
- M1-F05: test_thumbnail_displayed - <img> with thumbnail src
- V3-F01: test_status_badge_colors - Each status has distinct color
- V3-F02: test_status_polling - Status auto-refreshes (polls every 5s on non-ready videos)
- V3-F03: test_ready_notification - Badge changes to "Ready" when processing completes
- S1-F01: test_search_bar_renders - Input field present
- S1-F02: test_search_submits_query - Enter key calls API
- S1-F03: test_search_loading_state - Spinner shown during search
- S3-F01: test_search_result_shows_timestamp - "at 1:23" visible in result
- S3-F02: test_search_result_link_navigates - Click pushes /videos/{id}?t=

### E2E Scenarios
- E2E-01 (steps 7-11): Search, see results, click timestamp, navigate to player
- E2E-02 (step 1-2): Library â†’ click video â†’ player
- E2E-03: Library filtering by status, sorting by date
- E2E-04: Search with no results

### Quality Gate
This feature is NOT complete until:
- All M1-*, V3-F*, S1-F*, S3-F* tests pass
- Library page displays video cards with thumbnails and status badges
- Filtering and sorting work
- Search returns results and navigates to video on click
- Navigation between Library, Upload, Search works
- Status badges show correct colors

- docs/design/search-api.md - Search endpoint response format
- docs/design/technology-stack.md - React, Tailwind, react-router versions
- docs/implementation/phase1.md - Frontend pages, components, routes

-{"id":"w-zqu","title":"Video Upload & Storage","description":"# Feature: Video Upload & Storage

## Overview
Implement the video upload flow end-to-end: backend API endpoint for receiving MKV files with metadata, file storage to disk, database record creation, Celery task dispatch, and the frontend upload form with progress indication. This is the entry point for all video content in the system.

## User Stories Covered
- V1: Upload MKV with metadata (title, date, participants, notes)
- V3 (partial): Initial status set to "uploaded", status endpoint

## Technical Context

### Files to Create
- `backend/app/api/routes/videos.py` - POST /api/videos (multipart upload), GET /api/videos/{id}, GET /api/videos/{id}/status
- `backend/app/services/video.py` - Video CRUD: create_video (save file, create DB record, queue task), get_video, get_video_status
- `frontend/src/pages/UploadPage.tsx` - Upload page with form and progress
- `frontend/src/components/upload/UploadForm.tsx` - Form fields: file input (.mkv only), title, date, participants (comma-separated), context notes
- `frontend/src/components/upload/UploadProgress.tsx` - Upload progress bar using axios onUploadProgress
- `frontend/src/api/videos.ts` - API client: uploadVideo(), getVideo(), getVideoStatus()
- `backend/tests/unit/test_video_schema.py` - Schema validation tests
- `backend/tests/integration/test_video_api.py` - Upload API integration tests
- `frontend/src/__tests__/components/UploadForm.test.tsx` - Frontend upload tests

### Files to Modify
- `backend/app/main.py` - Register video routes
- `backend/app/api/routes/__init__.py` - Export video router
- `frontend/src/App.tsx` - Wire up UploadPage route

### Dependencies
- Feature 1 (Project Scaffolding) must be complete - provides models, DB, config, Docker

### Key Design Decisions
- File upload via multipart/form-data (python-multipart)
- Files saved to /data/videos/original/{uuid}.mkv
- Participants parsed from comma-separated string to TEXT[] array
- Upload endpoint returns video ID immediately, processing is async
- File extension validation: only .mkv accepted (400 for others)
- Title and recording_date are required fields (422 for missing)
- After DB record creation, dispatch Celery task for processing (video_processing.delay(video_id))
- Status endpoint supports polling from frontend

## Implementation Notes
- Upload endpoint must handle large files (streaming to disk, not memory)
- Use UploadFile from FastAPI for file handling
- Save file with UUID-based filename to avoid conflicts: {video_id}.mkv
- Frontend UploadForm uses controlled inputs with React state
- Progress bar uses axios upload progress callback
- After successful upload, redirect to library or show success message
- Participants field: split on comma, trim whitespace, store as array
- data-testid attributes on form elements for E2E testing: upload-form, file-input, title-input, date-input, participants-input, submit-btn, progress-bar, success-message

## Testing Requirements

### Test Specification Reference
- Document: docs/testing/phase1-test-specification.md
- Sections: V1: Video Upload, V3: Processing Status (partial)

### Unit Tests
- V1-U01: test_video_schema_validation - Valid data passes, invalid rejected
- V1-U02: test_video_file_extension_validation - Only .mkv accepted, non-MKV gets 400
- V1-U03: test_video_metadata_required_fields - Missing title/date returns 422
- V1-U04: test_participants_array_parsing - "Alice, Bob" stored as ["Alice", "Bob"]
- V3-U01: test_status_enum_values - All expected status values defined

### Integration Tests
- V1-I01: test_upload_creates_video_record - POST /api/videos creates DB record with status=uploaded
- V1-I02: test_upload_stores_file - File saved to /data/videos/original/
- V1-I03: test_upload_triggers_processing_task - Celery task queued (mock Celery)
- V1-I04: test_upload_returns_video_id - Response includes valid UUID
- V3-I02: test_status_endpoint_returns_current - GET /api/videos/{id}/status returns status

### Frontend Unit Tests
- V1-F01: test_upload_form_renders - All fields visible
- V1-F02: test_upload_form_validation - Error shown for missing title
- V1-F03: test_file_type_restriction - File input accepts .mkv only
- V1-F04: test_upload_progress_display - Progress bar updates

### E2E Scenarios
- E2E-01 (steps 1-5): Upload form, fill metadata, submit, observe progress
- E2E-05: Upload corrupted video, observe error handling

### Quality Gate
This feature is NOT complete until:
- All V1-U*, V1-I*, V1-F* tests pass
- V3-I02 (status endpoint) passes
- Upload flow works manually via curl and via frontend
- File lands on disk and DB record is created

## Reference Documentation
- docs/design/data-model.md - Video table schema
- docs/design/processing-pipeline.md - Upload trigger flow
- docs/implementation/phase1.md - API endpoints, project structure
- docs/testing/phase1-test-specification.md - V1, V3 test specs","status":"tombstone","priority":2,"issue_type":"feature","created_at":"2026-02-07T13:54:35.763931975+02:00","updated_at":"2026-02-07T14:15:16.595814328+02:00","close_reason":"Starting fresh - recreating features with proper dependencies","dependencies":[{"issue_id":"w-zqu","depends_on_id":"w-7ib","type":"blocks","created_at":"2026-02-07T14:10:29.554923856+02:00","created_by":"daemon"}],"deleted_at":"2026-02-07T14:15:16.595814328+02:00","deleted_by":"daemon","delete_reason":"delete","original_type":"feature"}

2. Verify all videos visible
3. Filter by status=ready
4. Verify only A and C visible
5. Sort by date descending
6. Verify order: C, A
7. Clear filters
8. Verify B shows processing indicator

E2E-04: Search with No Results
Preconditions: Test video processed
Steps:
1. Navigate to Search page
2. Search for 'nonexistent term xyz123'
3. Verify no results message displayed
4. Search for '' (empty)
5. Verify appropriate handling

+  1. Line 46: bd show <feature-id> and bd show <task-id> â€” the coordinator's prompt already tells the coder to do this. Having it here too means the coder reads it in two places and might run it twice. Not a conflict, just redundant.                                                                                                                                                                                                                          
+  2. Line 47: "review their descriptions to understand what's built" â€” the coordinator's prompt now tells the coder to bd list | grep <feature-id> instead of reading individual task descriptions. This line could cause the coder to run bd show on each closed task anyway, undoing what we optimized in the loop prompt.                                                                                                                                       
+  3. Lines 106-119: "Context Limit Reached" section assumes the agent will notice it's running low and write handoff notes. We established this doesn't happen â€” the agent crashes without warning. This section is misleading. The heuristics (10+ files, 15+ turns) are unreliable.                                                                                                                                                                              
+  4. Line 131: "Tasks should modify 1-3 files, read 5-8 max" â€” we noted this was routinely violated (w-csa.5 read 12+ files, w-csa.8 read dozens). Unrealistic guideline.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          
+  5. Lines 80-83: "Only close the task when: ... Code is committed" â€” but the Task Complete section (line 96-102) does the commit after bd close. So the code isn't committed when the task is closed. Minor ordering contradiction.                                                                                                                                                                                                                               
+  6. Lines 55-56: "Commit incrementally after each logical unit of progress" â€” but Task Complete says to commit code + beads together in a single commit. If the agent commits incrementally during work AND does a final commit with beads, that's fine. But "incrementally" might conflict with the single-commit pattern for agents that complete in one shot.
\ No newline at end of file
